noun.description: The main body of a ship or other vessel, including the bottom, sides, and deck but not the masts, superstructure, rigging, engines, and other fittings.

verb.description: Hit and pierce the hull of (a ship) with a shell or other missile.

proper noun.description: A city and port in northeastern England, situated at the junction of the Hull and Humber Rivers; population 263,000 (est. 2009).

origin: Old English hulu, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch huls, German Hülse husk, pod, and German Hülle covering, also to heel.
